metadata.topic_title: Sponsoring Qualified Individuals for Professional Advancement

hierarchy.subdomain: Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the ethical implications of sponsoring a highly skilled but ethically questionable individual versus a moderately skilled but ethically sound one. Use NICE Framework KSAs to justify your position and reference real-world cybersecurity breaches (e.g., insider threats) as examples.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct. Topic: 'Sponsoring Qualified Individuals for Professional Advancement' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct > Professional Responsibilities and Duties > Professional Advancement and Mentorship > Sponsoring Qualified Individuals). **Completed Research Context** (integrate fully): ## Sponsoring Qualified Individuals for Professional Advancement in Cybersecurity Core Concepts: Professional Advancement (career growth to senior roles like CISO); Sponsorship (active advocacy by sponsor for protégé); Qualified Individuals (assessed via skills/experience/potential per standards); Cybersecurity Workforce (NICE-defined). Industry Standards: NICE Framework (NIST SP 800-181r1): 7 Work Role Categories (Oversee and Govern, Protect and Defend, Analyze, Collect and Operate, Investigate, Operate and Maintain, Securely Provision); 52 Work Roles (e.g., Cyber Defense Analyst under Protect/Defend); Tasks; KSAs (e.g., K0001: IT security principles). Competency Areas: Align sponsorship by mapping protégé KSAs to Work Roles/levels (Awareness, Basic, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert). Ethical tie-in: Sponsors ensure competence to uphold codes (e.g., (ISC)²: Act honorably/professionally). Sponsorship Process: Assess NICE fit → Advocate opportunities → Mentor → Evaluate progress. Sources: NIST SP 800-181r1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-181r1.pdf); NICCS/CISA (https://niccs.cisa.gov/workforce-development/nice-framework); (ISC)² Code (https://www.isc2.org/ethics). **Pedagogy Integration**: - Learning Objectives: [insert array above]. - Scaffolding: Generate flashcards across 4 layers [insert scaffolding above]. - Active Learning: Tie flashcards to activities [insert active_learning above] (e.g., 'Use for peer teaching'). - Bloom's: Balanced coverage. **Generate Flashcards** per schema [insert flashcard_schema above].
